name: Czero
tag_list: mechanical-engineering, mechanical-engineering-rd, electromechanical-engineering, electrohydraulic-engineering, clean-technology-engineering, clean-tech-engineering, clean-energy, energy-conversion
overview:
A specialized mechanical engineering R&D firm, Czero develops new technologies for energy efficiency, energy recovery and renewable fuels.

Czero works in both the private and public sectors, providing consulting and concept-to-prototype R&D services for inventors, start-ups, original equipment manufacturers (OEMs), and government agencies in North America, Europe, and Australia.

The firm’s special areas of focus include high-bandwidth hydraulics, advanced machine design, automotive powertrains, fuel systems, valve systems, hybrid vehicles, distributed power generation and smart grids, natural gas conversions, and renewable fuels including algae-based biofuels.

Located in Fort Collins, Colorado, Czero is part of the Rocky Mountain Innosphere, a launch pad for high-opportunity ventures in science and technology. Czero was founded in 2007 by engineering R&D veterans of the automotive and heavy-duty truck industry.

In 2010, Czero’s founders received the Bravo “Emerging Entrepreneur” award presented by the Northern Colorado Business Report
